column6: Operations and suppliers at significant risk for incidents of child labor
column13: In 2023, through its ESG risk assessment processes (which form part of the credit risk and due diligence process), including media scanning, NAB identified many customers with potential human rights and modern slavery concerns within their operations or supply chains. Further investigation and/or customer engagement has confirmed poor labour practices and other potential human rights concerns. NAB and BNZ have taken action, engaged relevant customers and are monitoring the actions these customers are taking to address the issues as appropriate.
column20: ESG risk assessment, media scanning, credit risk and due diligence

column6: Operations and suppliers ar significant risk for incidents of forced or compulsory labor
column13: NAB's human rights grievance process identifies how human rights issues and concerns are investigated and acted upon. One mechanism for receiving human rights-related feedback and concerns is NAB's mailbox grievances@nab.com.au. Grievances received in this mailbox are referred to the appropriate area for investigation and action.
column20: Human rights grievance process, human rights issue, mailbox

column6: Operations and suppliers ar significant risk for incidents of forced or compulsory labor
column13: In 2022, NAB engaged a specialist business and human rights advisory firm to review its human rights grievance mechanism against the effectiveness criteria set out in the UN Guiding Principles on Business and Human Rights. The review identified several areas where NAB could make incremental improvements to strengthen its grievance mechanism. As a result, several small changes were made to guidance for colleagues in 2023.
column20: Human rights grievance mechanism, human rights advisory firm, UN Guiding Principles

column6: Operations and suppliers ar significant risk for incidents of forced or compulsory labor
column13: In 2023, NAB commenced an in-depth review of modern slavery risk in the renewable energy sector. As part of the review process, NAB has engaged with several relevant customers and referred to various external guidance, including information provided in the CEC Report and by other international renewable energy industry bodies, advice from NAB's internal ESG experts and other external sources and experts. Progress to date includes a portfolio review to confirm high-risk jurisdictions and activities are correctly identified and engagement with external experts to help identify where NAB can improve frameworks, guidance and risk management practices.
column20: Modern slavery risk, renewable energy sector, high-risk jurisdiction

column6: Security personnel trained in human rights policies or procedures
column13: A Respect@NAB training module has been added to NAB's People Leader Fundamentals program, designed to educate People Leaders on NAB's legislative obligations and to foster an environment that reduces the likelihood of bullying, harassment and other inappropriate conduct.

column6: Incidents of violations involving rights of indigenous peoples
column13: NAB developed and mandated its cultural awareness training for Australian-based colleagues to help build their understanding of Australia's shared history, as well as NAB's initiatives and objectives and how these relate to the work of NAB's colleagues and their ability to support customers effectively.
column20: Cultural awareness training, shared history, customer

Operations with local community engagement, impact assessments, and development programs
column13: NAB was the first Australian corporate business to achieve 'Elevate' Reconciliation Action Plan (RAP) status for its leadership in reconciliation. NAB is developing its next three-year RAP for 2024-2026. It builds on the ambition of NAB's previous RAPs and ultimately aligns with its objective to drive commercial growth in the First Nations business sector through initiatives aligned with key pillars: customers, colleagues and community.
column20: Reconciliation Action Plan, reconciliation, First Nation

column6: Operations with local community engagement, impact assessments, and development programs
column13: NAB Neighbourhood is NAB's platform to engage colleagues and community organisations in philanthropic initiatives. Colleagues can participate in volunteering, giving, fundraising and granting activities to support causes they care about.
column20: NAB Neighbourhood, community organisation, philanthropic activity

column6: Operations with local community engagement, impact assessments, and development programs
column13: NAB Foundation is a registered charity that uses philanthropy, social investment and in-kind support to fund social and environmental progress in Australian communities served by NAB. By funding the people and communities who make a real difference, the NAB Foundation aims to help tackle social and environmental challenges relevant to NAB, natural disasters, climate transition, indigenous economic advancement and affordable housing.
column20: NAB Foundation, social investment, Indigenous economic advancement

column6: Operations with local community engagement, impact assessments, and development programs
column13: The NAB Foundation Community Grants program offers grants to local community-led projects for disaster readiness and recovery across Australia. It aims to award $1 million annually in grants of up to $10,000 each, with an additional $200,000 available for up to eight projects demonstrating potential to scale impact.
column20: NAB Foundation Community Grants, local community, disaster readiness

column6: Operations with local community engagement, impact assessments, and development programs
column13: In 2023, the NAB Foundation announced a flagship partnership, providing $1 million in funding to help Disaster Relief Australia (DRA) bolster its community and corporate volunteer capacity over the next two years. The partnership will assist DRA in recruiting and managing more than 3,000 community members on stand-by to volunteer.
column20: Disaster Relief Australia, volunteer capacity, community

column6: Operations with significant actual and potential negative impacts on local communities
column13: NAB's "Walking together" Indigenous star illustrates the recognition of Indigenous Australians' contribution to culture and NAB's ambition to support their financial inclusion and economic aspirations. The idea came from proud Kamilaroi man and NAB colleague Kieran Cain-Hall. Marcus Lee, a proud Aboriginal descendant of the Karajarri people from North Western Australia, designed it.
column20: Walking Together, Indigenous star, Karajarri people

column6: New suppliers that were screened using social criteria
column13: A commitment to respecting human rights is a core foundation for NAB Group's Human Rights Policy and the codes of conduct. It is also integrated within several key voluntary initiatives. NAB is a signatory, including the Principles for Responsible Banking and the United Nations Global Compact.
column20: Human Rights Policy, human rights, codes of conduct

column6: Negative social impacts in the supply chain and actions taken
column7: NAB received 13 complaints alleging discrimination filed in Courts, human rights/equal opportunity commissions, or tribunals.

column6: Political contributions
column7: In 2022 (1 July 2021-30 June 2022), NAB spent $60,500 with the Australian Labor Party, $60,000 with the Liberal Party of Australia, and $33,000 with the National Party of Australia.

column13: In 2023, NAB achieved the National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST) Cyber security capability maturity level (across people, processes, and technology). The National Institute of Standards and Technology (US Government) Cyber Security framework helps businesses understand, manage and reduce cyber security risks. This improvement has reduced NAB's time to contain cyber threats by 51% since 2019.
column20: Cyber security capability maturity level, NIST, Cyber Security Framework

column6: Substantiated complaints concerning breaches of customer privacy and losses of customer data
column13: NAB implemented several new features to protect its customers. These include new customer phishing and scam protections, including removing links in SMS and emails, contributing to reducing scam payments. In addition, NAB has recently announced its participation in an industry digital identity verification service (Connect ID), which helps customers securely share their identity information.
column20: Customer phishing and scam protection, scam payment, digital identity verification

column6: Substantiated complaints concerning breaches of customer privacy and losses of customer data
column13: NAB has a specialist Global Privacy Office, which establishes data protection and uses principles to ensure colleagues know their responsibilities. These responsibilities are embedded into the way NAB works and support transparent, fair and compliant use and sharing of personal information of customers and colleagues.
column20: Global Privacy Office, data protection, personal information

column6: Substantiated complaints concerning breaches of customer privacy and losses of customer data
column13: NAB's Data Ethics Framework goes beyond legal compliance to consider not if NAB can use data (legally or otherwise) but whether it should. NAB's Data Ethics Principles set out how it should responsibly use data and guide how data is used in analytics, machine learning, artificial intelligence (AI) and sharing with third parties. These Data Ethics Principles are brought to life through a Data Ethics assessment process.
column20: Data Ethics Framework, Data Ethics Principle, machine learning

column6: Substantiated complaints concerning breaches of customer privacy and losses of customer data
column13: The NAB Records Management Policy Standard governs data collection, storage, retention and destruction within the NAB. The Standard is supported by a series of Record Retention Schedules, which ensure compliance with recordkeeping obligations across all regions.
column20: NAB Records Management Policy, data collection, Record Retention Schedule
